Review: that's the thing about both money and undead succubus princesses: they make you forget what's really important
who says that we do not get to keep being accountants after death

suits in the jungle, old money in the new world, right and wrong ways to discuss your family's castle in geneva, useless sons and mournful fathers, priests who play the currency market, the aristocratic invention of privacy and its hieroglyph the swimming pool.

the symmetries stood out to me on a second viewing. kafuku's dead child with oto would be about misaki's age, misaki's absent father is a kafuku-shaped void. lee yoon-a's korean sign language over vanya's shoulders in the crushing last scene of the play tells & shows him that he's not the only person in the world who suffers, once misaki and kafuku understand where each other is coming & that it's the same place there's a release from blame no one else could have offered.

the elevator stops counting on its way down from the penthouses because when you're close enough to the street, no one knows you. wearing cheap cologne, the kind they sell on airplanes, to the handoff. the city out of proportion to the lone night walker, a unit of human motion that doesn't fit anywhere. the unaccompanied dead body, the stiff, attracts a crowd; the unaccompanied live body repels one.
“Well, what do we do?”“Why don’t we just wait here for a little while. See what happens.”

sets like you wouldn’t believe, Dr Van Helsing’s mirrored cigarette case outs Dracula for a shade, the prolific Pablo Álvarez Rubio as contaminated Renfield a wonderful flailer, lots of mugging for the camera whenever the doctors and society types see a bite mark
duel-worthy offenses in antebellum louisiana: saying ladies' names in a bar, making a bet concerning members of a gentleman's family, coarseness at dinner, passim.

highland park kids who smile too big always land on their feet. all the president’s men for a world where hallowed newsroom ethics square off with the content mill. feel like this exact guy would get away with it now and is likely doing so. RIP the new republic, dead of facebook poisoning this many a day.

when your job sucks and someone in a diner offers you a hookup on some paperweights, always say yes. you’ll have plenty more opportunities to sleep but if you don’t spend all night in soho finding a string of lonely beautiful nightcrawlers slightly beneath your standards as a square word processor who doesn’t know the train gets more expensive at night, that chance won’t come again.
Nothing will happen to you miss. We're all good people here!
